attributes.magic: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked, interpreter /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factors were that it has known exploits and it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: The binary is classified as ransomware. It contains a Tor .onion URL for command and control or payment instructions (mblogci3rudehaagbryjznltdp33ojwzkq6hn2pckvjq33rycmzczpid.onion). The presence of strings like "/readme.txt" and "for negotiations or send requests to the police/FBI/investigators..." are indicative of a ransom note. The extensive inclusion of cryptographic libraries (OpenSSL, AES, RSA) and an embedded RSA public key strongly suggests its primary function is to encrypt files.
